quest.name: The Triumphs We Share
journal: The Sultansworn elite sports a faintly troubled expression, as if straining to remember something important.

"To ye who ask of things to come:
Give thought to what is past and gone.“

With the long-dead poet king's words still ringing in your ears, you continue your pilgrimage, retracing the steps you took in the days following your exile.

What cruel fate, to lose her father as a child, and be compelled to rule in his stead. And how the years had tempered her dreams and taught her, sometimes brutally, the price of naivety. Though outwardly unscathed by her ordeal, it was a wiser and more wary Nanamo who reclaimed the throne...

"For the freedom of all.“ It had begun with an oath and ended with a betrayal, as the conspirators turned on their comrades for coin and country. The good and true were beaten and imprisoned, or else butchered where they stood. But even in their darkest moments, Alianne and the other loyalists knew that the dawn's light would shine again...

Despite the many hardships they had endured─or perhaps because of them─Biggs and Wedge greeted every new challenge with a smile. Their workshop their battlefield, their tools their weapons, they invariably rose to the occasion, delivering ingenious solutions to seemingly insoluble problems...

Through tempestuous winds they carved a path, breaching the dread wyrm's sanctum, and there did they put him to the sword. Yet in the wake of hard-fought victory were secrets laid bare in a vision dark and disturbing. The legacy of the fathers, bequeathed to their sons and passed down through the generations... Old blood enduring in the new, the mark of original sin...

A world apart from the opulence of the Pillars, Hilda and her people toiled, shrouded in the haze of the Brume. Sentenced to a life of hardship by birth, they dreamed of revolution as children dream of faeries. Then one came and went, and they suddenly found themselves with a seat at the table...

An earnest, good-natured people, the Zundu tribe had borne witness to the rage of their beloved god's twisted manifestation, and proclaimed it to be false. By the grace of kind travelers were they duly delivered from its wrath, the mad god's death signaling the birth of a new hero...

Y'mhitra knew that her sister had been under no illusions as to the dangers of the life she had chosen. Should the worst come to the worst, Y'shtola would do what needed to be done─pay any price, make any sacrifice, and that without hesitation. She was a woman of conviction, deserving of respect and admiration...and no small amount of worry...

From the ashes of an abandoned colony would their brave new nation rise─a free and equal society for goblin and man, in which scholars and craftsmen could work together to build a better life. It would be nothing short of a paradise...in theory, at least...
objectives: Visit the Skysteel Manufactory in Ishgard.
Visit the Monsterie in the Churning Mists.
Visit Lonu Vanu at Ok' Zundu.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER01477
dialogue.text: W-Wait, I know you! You're Forename! Forename Surname!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER01477
dialogue.text: What a stroke of luck! I can think of none better qualified to help us. You see, it is no mere noblewoman that we seek─

dialogue.name: SOLDIER01477
dialogue.text: Ah, but Master Papashan was most explicit about the need for secrecy... Pray forget I mentioned it. We will find the su─ We will find the lady on our own.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ...What cruel fate, to lose her father as a child, and be compelled to rule in his stead. And how the years had tempered her dreams and taught her, sometimes brutally, the price of naivety. Though outwardly unscathed by her ordeal, it was a wiser and more wary Nanamo who reclaimed the throne...

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: There you are, Forename. Higiri told me of your pilgrimage. I knew it was only a matter of time before you sought me out.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: I too have been reflecting on the choices which shaped my path. When I took to the road with my grandfather...when I joined the Crystal Braves...when I tried and failed to warn you before the banquet...

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: I had my suspicions about Wilred's death─that it was the work of a Garlean spy within our ranks. But I could not be sure who was involved, hence my desire to speak with you in private.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: I thought long and hard about how to approach you without arousing suspicion... Mayhap too long. Eventually, I decided to arrange a meeting through Mistress Momodi. Little did I know that bastard Laurentius had seen me do it.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: Shortly thereafter, the Fourth received urgent summons. Needless to say, I had no choice but to answer...and soon found myself at the mercy of Captain Ilberd's band of traitors.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: They confined me to the Rising Stones, along with others still loyal to the Scions─Riol, Ephemie, Aergmhus... Quite what they planned to do with us, I couldn't say. Mayhap they thought we would turn, given time. The fools...

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: Lieutenant Yuyuhase bid the Third keep us under constant guard, but when Captain Ilberd moved to carry out General Raubahn's execution, they were forced to withdraw all but a token force, which we took by surprise one night. And then it was over.

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: One might argue that it turned out better than it had any right to, all things considered. Still, there are nights when I lie awake wondering, if I had done things differently─if I had been more careful, or more decisive─what then...

dialogue.name: ALIANNE
dialogue.text: But there is naught to be gained from thinking thus. We must count our blessings, must we not? We are still here, and most of what was broken can be rebuilt. You will see, Forename. You will see.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ...“For the freedom of all.” It had begun with an oath and ended with a betrayal, as the conspirators turned on their comrades for coin and country. The good and true were beaten and imprisoned, or else butchered where they stood. But even in their darkest moments, they never stopped believing that the dawn's light would shine again...

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Why, hello there, Forename! Fancy meeting you here!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Reminiscing about the glory days, eh? Aye, we spent many a sleepless night hammering away in that corner of ours. How's your manacutter holding up, by the way?

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Hah! That's good to hear. Not that I had any doubts, like─our craftsmanship's second to none!

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Quite right! It will take more than swirling winds and raging dragons to bring her down─and that, my friend, is an Ironworks' guarantee!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Speaking of which─on the back of the field test's success, we've gone ahead and licensed the design for mass production. Soon, the Skysteel Manufactory will be churning out manacutters by the dozen!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: ...Which is why we're here today, as a matter of fact─to make sure their machinists don't bugger anything up.

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Apparently, adventurers have been queuing up to place an order─and even some sky pirates! Ah, just imagining the Sea of Clouds teeming with our creations fills me with a father's pride!

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Right, then─that's enough patting ourselves on the back! We've got to make sure the 'cutters are up to snuff, or Jessie'll never let us hear the end of it. From now till we finish, there'll be no more breaks, distractions, and not one wink of sleep, d'you hear me!?

dialogue.name: WEDGE
dialogue.text: Oh... <mumble> <mumble> ...ing cart chocobo.

dialogue.name: BIGGS
dialogue.text: Well, we'll leave you to it. Till next time, eh!?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ...Despite the many hardships they had endured─or perhaps because of them─they greeted every new challenge with a smile. Their workshop their battlefield, their tools their weapons, they invariably rose to the occasion, delivering ingenious solutions to seemingly insoluble problems...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ...Through tempestuous winds they carved a path, breaching the dread wyrm's sanctum, and there did they put him to the sword. Yet in the wake of hard-fought victory were secrets laid bare in a vision dark and disturbing.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The legacy of the fathers, bequeathed to their sons and passed down through the generations... Old blood enduring in the new, the mark of original sin...

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: And there shehe is, at last. Gibrillont said you were wanderin' all over, reminiscin' about days gone by. Seems a bit soon if you ask me.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: It's not like I don't understand, though. Some days, I'll be walkin' through the Brume, same as normal, and it'll hit me all of a sudden just how much has changed for us─though I know it's a bit different from what you've been through.

dialogue.name: SYMME
dialogue.text: Puts me in mind of the first time I saw herhim and herhis friends up near the aetheryte, being shown around by that House Fortemps man.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Oh? You never told me you'd met before.

dialogue.name: SYMME
dialogue.text: It weren't so much a meeting as a heckling, to be honest. When I heard their guide warning them off paying a visit to the Brume, it stuck in my craw. And you've got to admit that Master Alphinaud's the spitting image of a snotty little lordling...

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: A little lordling that went on to fight two knights of the Heavens' Ward with Forename here in a trial by combat─not to mention helpin' retake the Vault from the True Brothers. Fury have mercy...it feels like a bleedin' lifetime ago, don't it?

dialogue.name: EUDESTAND
dialogue.text: 'Cause it was. What we've got now's nothin' like what came before. It's a bleedin' rebirth is what it is.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: Cold comfort to the folk who died gettin' us here. Still, this peace is ours, and we owe it to ourselves to make the most of it.

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: ...Meanin' we've got to work twice as hard to make the Brume a better place! And no more harassin' blue bloods neither!

dialogue.name: SYMME
dialogue.text: (-Symme and Eudestand-)Aye, aye!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ...A world apart from the opulence of the Pillars, they had toiled, shrouded in the haze of the Brume. Sentenced to a life of hardship by birth, they dreamed of revolution as children dream of faeries. Then one came and went, and they suddenly found themselves with a seat at the table...

dialogue.name: HILDA
dialogue.text: I know you got Ser Charibert in the end, but I have to admit, I'm still a little bitter that it wasn't me. Gave me reason to practice my marksmanship, though.

dialogue.name: SYMME
dialogue.text: Hahaha! Just goes to show that you can't judge a man by appearances, eh? Nor tell what fate's got in store for you. All the more reason to watch your words when you're in your cups!

dialogue.name: EUDESTAND
dialogue.text: Perhaps it's time the watch expanded its duties. Maybe help out with the reconstruction efforts...

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: Ho, clouds part and let shine brilliant sun upon Lonu Vanu! Great netherling warrior returns to Ok' Zundu, and on pilgrimage of remembrance? Well, well!

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: We bid you warmest welcome, slayer of false gods and champion of fallen Gundu─whose fledgling village continues to grow and prosper, now free from the shadow of Vundu oppression.

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: Know that we will always be grateful to you for your victory over the ravenous White. No longer need we fear for the safety of our smallest islands.

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: But Lonu Vanu is not one to forget netherling's first coming, when shehe saves us from certain death at the hands of the black ones, distant memory though it is.

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: Yes! HerHis many deeds are the stuff of legends! We shall remember the stories, and the hero's name, Forename Surname, for they are worthy of celebration now and ever after!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ...An earnest, good-natured people, they had borne witness to the rage of their beloved god's twisted manifestation, and proclaimed it to be false. By the grace of kind travelers were they duly delivered from its wrath, the mad god's death signaling the birth of a new hero...

dialogue.name: LONUVANU
dialogue.text: If it pleases netherling, you are welcome to partake of fresh wamouracampae before parting. Tender, supple flesh gives way to sticky─ No? Then as raging typhoon strips fields bare, Lonu Vanu shall devour all!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Well met, Forename. What brings you here this nightday?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Indeed... Though it seems an age, it was not all that long ago that we rescued Shtola from the Lifestream. How quickly we begin to forget even those memories most precious to us.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: In my defense, I might add that I have rarely missed an opportunity to make new memories with my sister in the days since her return.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Our conversations are largely on matters of scientific and professional concern─ancient Allagan technologies, primals, Ascians, and so forth. She has an insatiable thirst for knowledge, as you know.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Yet while I understand her desire not to burden those around her with her troubles, and to carry on as she did before, I do worry that her willingness to manipulate her own aether to compensate for the loss of her sight may have dire repercussions...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...She never told you, then? But of course not. 'Twould rather have defeated the purpose.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You should know that the technique she employs places a tremendous strain on her body. She is, of course, well aware of her limits...and more than willing to ignore them should she deem it necessary. I pray you see that she does not.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Regrettably, she is wont to ignore my advice when it does not suit her. Yet given your shared experiences, mayhap she will be more willing to heed your warnings.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ...Her sister was under no illusions as to the dangers of the life she had chosen. Should the worst come to the worst, Y'shtola would do what needed to be done─pay any price, make any sacrifice, and that without hesitation. She was a woman of conviction, deserving of respect and admiration...and no small amount of worry...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Alas, my studies of Allagan technology have not yielded any earth-shattering revelations of late. Rest assured, however, that I will inform Tataru immediately should that unhappy state of affairs chance to change.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Pshkohhh... Why must governing great gobbie nation be so difficult!? Like herding coeurls. Stupid coeurls with muchly differing views on glorious nation's future direction!

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: ...Yes, yes, Slowfix knows he is letting emotions run wild. Uplander is welcome voice of reason!

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Not like when uplanders first returned to Idyllshire, yes? So much venom in that one's tongueflaps, calling gobbieflock thieves! But Slowfix saw way to mutual understanding.

dialogue.name: SLOWFIX
dialogue.text: Citizenship in society first step in strengthening communal ties! Gives all vested interest in continued prosperity of egalitarian utopia!
